intro: Galactophora schomburgkiana, commonly known as the Schomburgk's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Galactophora schomburgkiana is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in open areas with well-drained soil.
